title: Task 59

question.text: What does Tom plan to do later?

answers.answer: He plans not to do anything about the issue
answers.feedback: Tom actually plans to do something important.

answers.answer: He will make sure to document the issue

answers.feedback: Tom is talking about what he will do in the future, not what he has already done.

answers.answer: He will forget to document the issue
answers.feedback: Tom says I'll make sure, which means he is certain about doing something.

dialogue.text: It happens to all of us, Maria. I'll make sure to document this for future reference, so we won't run into the same problem again.

description:
Tom uses I'll (short for I will) to talk about what he plans to do later.

Will is often used when someone decides to do something in the future. For example, I'll call you later means the person plans to call sometime after now.
